title: Constant, Extremely High Ping
body: So when I used to play LoL a little while ago, the highest MS I would get was around 80. Now for over a month, it has been a constant 200+. Just so you guys all know, 300mbs+ download speed, wired connection, have tried with and without firewall, port forwarded for LoL, tried playing without any processes in the background, tried repairing and reinstalling, tried flushing and changing DNS, and this is the only game with any connection issues at all whatsoever. Nothing I have read anywhere has helped at all and I'm really on my last straw for this entire game just because of this issue. Does anyone have some possible solutions?

replies.body:
Based on the steps you've already tried, it seems that you may have worked through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) already. Because latency is largely impacted by how your connection is routed to the server, we'll need to take a look at your exact ISP routing to the NA server specifically. 

To do this, I recommend grabbing a great network analysis application called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) and running a 5 minute traceroute using the IP address 192.64.170.1

After the trace has run for 5 minutes, export your results as text and either upload them to pastebin or paste them into a reply here. I'll be able to point out where in your route you're specifically having issues.

It looks like your latency hits 233ms right on the first node outside of your home network at 173-219-222-45.suddenlink.net.

Your latency then sticks in the mid 200's until it hits our servers at 104.160.133.35. Since your latency is consistently high across your route to the NA servers, you'll want to reach out to your ISP's tier 2 tech support so they can investigate further. When you reach out, be sure to provide them this traceroute log, as it will give them specific context as to where your issue is occurring. 

Let me know if you have any additional questions.

I went ahead and contacted them, and they sent the information over to their engineers, but they said for me to just check back in a couple days and run another tracer. Would it be okay for me to use this thread as the final verdict as to whether it's fixed or not?
